word: It is easy work to visit churches and be waited upon, but it is not an easy work to seek to win one's way into the hearts of the people. Would to God we had one hundred women consecrated to the work, going forth as missionaries, toiling in the harvest field. I wish there were more Frenchmen who could labor where the Americans can do nothing. These brethren's nature is not exactly like their brethren's, but their brethren have been too zealous to bring them exactly to their minds and their ideas, and have not given them elbow room to act themselves.
